column4: iirc, initial install will give an "install page", where you can specify msql db, locations etc
I'm way past that. Installed fine, getting the Main_Page just fine. But I get blank pages for say if I click edit or discussion on Main_Page
since that's most likely not an ubuntu issue, you could as well ask in #mediawiki
Well. Given that it also happens with what aptitude install mediawiki creates, I'd say it was an ubuntu issue.
I only remember a successful install on 9.04, have not tried on 9.10 yet
just finished install of mw on 9.10 - no issues here...
if editing Main_Page works for you, then I guess I must have b0rked sometihng.
you edited the correct php.ini? (/etc/php5/apache2/php.ini) and reloaded apache?
No big deal. It isn't worth this much time to get mediawiki working, I'll just stick to org-mode for now. Thanks!
oddly, the apt-gotten mediawiki works now. :) Go figure
hm? As where the aptitude installed mw failed?

Early on, I had the same problem with an aptitude'd mediawiki. Then I tried with ~/public_html/ same problem. Now I tried with the stock ubuntu one, and that works now. Must have been the php memory limit
sorry, I use apt-get and aptitude interchangeably to refer to software gotten from repos, not hand-installed
yes. Lovely. Thanks again for your time
